title_sort: walt whitman to benjamin ticknor, 18 december 1881
title: Walt Whitman to Benjamin Ticknor, 18 December 1881
text: Camden N JDec. 18 '81My dear Ben: TicknorThank you for your (& O'Reilley'sO'Reilly's) suggestion about Swinburne—I cannot consent however to solicit him to write a notice—& must decline to do so—But I have dispatched to him by mail an autograph copy of the new edition, & a little bundle of slips of the new pieces & some notices—without however any letter from me)—I have sent to David Bogue a list of some forty or more special friends of L. of G.Leaves of Grass (& author) in Great Britain & on the continent & have requested him to inform them—by little printed circular or otherwise—that he is the London pub. & agent of the book—Walt Whitman☞The 15 copies for editors have not yet reach'dreached me—perhaps they will come to-morrow—have they been sent? Walt Whitman to Benjamin Ticknor, 18 December 1881
